title: Have a critical look at the (internal) use of Repo.methods
body:
Here is an initial list of methods that gather information that is also provided by `GitRepo.get_content_info()` or `AnnexRepo.get_content_annexinfo()`, or `GitRepo.status()` (in rare cases). Each of them individually is typically a little bit faster then the two above, however, they only get a single piece of info, while the others get all of them combined. So whenever more than one of the below is needed, an RF to using the new methods would translate into a speed-up.

AnnexRepo:
- `get_file_key()`
- `find()`
- `file_has_content()`
- `is_under_annex()`
- `info()`
- `get_annexed_files()`
- `get_contentlocation()`
- `get_file_backend()`

GitRepo:
- `get_indexed_files()` [GitPy]
- `get_files()` [GitPy]
- `is_submodule_modified() `
- `get_changed_files()`
- `get_missing_files()`
- `get_deleted_files()`
